text: Maxim Aleksandrovich Chuzhkov (; born 11 April 1987) is a Russian beach soccer player serving as goalkeeper. He is a three-time national champion for Rotor Volgograd, Lokomotiv Moscow and Kristall. ==Career== Maxim Chuzhkov was born in Samara. He was a gymnast for six years before switching to football. Chuzhkov discovered beach soccer in 2010, and one year later he joined Krylya Sovetov from Samara. From 2012 to 2014 he played for Rotor Volgograd, winning with them the club's first and only Russian Beach Soccer Championships trophy in 2014. In the final he shot one goal and after the match he was named best goalkeeper of the championships. He then switched to Lokomotiv Moscow in 2015. Two years later Lokomotiv became champions, defeating Kristall in the final. Chuzhkov was named best goalkeeper of the tournament. Since 2018, Chuzhkov is playing for Kristall, with which he became threefold national champion, when Kristall defeated Delta Saratov in 2018.Maxim Chuzhkov – Biography In 2019, Maxim Chuzhkov, Artur Paporotnyi, Anton Shkarin and Yuri Krashennikov each scored a goal at the 2019 FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup, resulting to a 7–1 after the whistle. ==Achievements== ===National team=== *Euro Beach Soccer League champion: 2014, 2017 ===Clubs=== *Mundialito de Clubes: 2017 *Russian National champion: 2014, 2017, 2018 *Russian Cup champion: 2014, 2016, 2018 *Russian Super Cup: 2018 ===Individually=== *2014 Russian National Championships – Best Goalkeeper *2015 Russian National Championships – Best Goalkeeper *2015 Russian National Championships – Best Goalkeeper *2017 Euro Beach Soccer League – Best Goalkeeper *2018 Euro Beach Soccer League, Stage 3 – Best Goalkeeper *2019 World Beach Games – Europe Qualifier – Best Goalkeeper, Best Assistant *2019 FIFA Beach Soccer World Cup qualification – Best Goalkeeper *2019 Beach Soccer Stars – Best Goalkeeper *2019 Beach Soccer Stars – Best Five ==References== ==External links== *Profile on Beach Soccer Russia *Profile on BSC Kristall Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:Russian beach soccer players Category:People from Samara, Russia Category:European Games competitors for Russia Category:Beach soccer players at the 2019 European Games
